cardList.front: look / seem + adjective: </br>Se ven bastante felices.
cardList.back: look / seem + adjective: </br>They look quite happy.

cardList.front: look like /seem like + noun: </br> Parecen una familia.
cardList.back: look like /seem like + noun: </br>They seem like a family.

cardList.front: Parece que están haciendo algo: </br>Parece que están celebrando un cumpleaños o aniversario.
cardList.back: seem to be doing: </br>They seem to be celebrating a birthday or anniversary.

cardList.front: Tal vez / Probablemente sea el cumpleaños del abuelo.
cardList.back: Maybe / Probably it's the grandfather's birthday.

cardList.front: could / may / might be: </br> El hombre del medio podría ser el abuelo.
cardList.back: could / may / might be: </br> The man in the middle might be the grandfather.

cardList.front: must be: </br>Debe ser el cumpleaños o aniversario de alguien.
cardList.back: must be: </br>It must be someone’s birthday or anniversary.

cardList.front: I think / I believe: </br>Creo que están celebrando el cumpleaños o aniversario de alguien.
cardList.back: I think / I believe: </br>I think they are celebrating someone’s birthday or anniversary.
